author: Mehboob Jeelani
text:
Jawaharlal Nehru University Students’ Union president Kanhaiya Kumar, who was arrested on sedition charge last month, met Congress vice-president Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday to thank him for standing up to the BJP government and demanding his release.

An eight-member delegation of the JNU Students’ Union and the All India Students Federation led by Mr. Kumar had a 20-minute “informal conversation” with Mr. Gandhi, in which they discussed “all the compelling issues” that have emerged in several universities ever since the BJP came to power at the Centre.

“He [Mr. Gandhi] said the autonomy of universities should not be violated at any cost,” said Jayant Jigyasu, a JNU student. “He also said whenever we need him he will be there for us.” Dispelling the notion that the meeting carried political undertones, Varun Aditya Singh Chouhan, a friend of Mr. Kumar, said that apart from discussing the unrest in universities, Mr. Gandhi was keen on knowing how JNU Students' Union leader spent his time in jail.
title: Kanhaiya thanks Rahul for support
